alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 07 at 5:50AM PST until January 09 at 6:02AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River At Centralia affecting Lewis County. .Heavy rain over the Southwest Interior lowlands as well as in the Central and Southern Washington Cascades pushed the Chehalis River at Centralia above flood stage early Friday morning. While the heavy rain is over, the river will continue to rise today cresting early Saturday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chehalis River At Centralia. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 172.0 feet, the Chehalis River in Lewis County will cause moderate flooding including Fort Borst Park...farms...and some residential and commercial areas...with water encroaching upon the first floor of some homes and businesses. Flooded roads include SR 6...Florida Ave...Donahue Rd...Airport Rd...Military Rd...and Nick Rd. Swift flood waters will cover some roads. This stage corresponds roughly to a Phase 2 flood in the Lewis County flood system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM PST Friday the stage was 168.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 AM PST Friday was 168.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 172.5 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 168.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 200 PM PST.
